706667f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Third (left) and Flatbush Aves.(right), showing the sinking of the Catskill Water Shaft on the site of the former Ritters Painless Dental Company building, now known as Temple Square.
1917.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706664f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Third and Flatbush Aves. It the background, is Flatbush Ave., and the Fulton Street Line of the B.M.T.
This site is now known as "Temple Square".
About 1920.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706665f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, at the S.W. corner of Third Ave., showing The Baptist Temple, Als0 seen is Third Ave., west side, south from Schermerhorn Street to Atlantic Ave., showing the Central Branch of the Y.W.C.A. at
No. 30.
July 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
